question.title: Why dont netty logs show proper class and package information

node.contents: I use SLF4J in my game server project which uses Slf4j and Log4j. However netty specific logs come out like below.

astNode.text: I use SLF4J in my game server project which uses Slf4j and Log4j. However netty specific logs come out like below.

node.contents: They dont show the actual netty class and package information. My corresponding Log4j pattern is:

astNode.text: They dont show the actual netty class and package information. My corresponding Log4j pattern is:

node.contents: This worked, but is there a way to only print out the file name? Now it prints the whole package like so -> io.netty.util.internal.PlatformDependent0:76 while I just require PlatformDpeendent0:76

astNode.text: This worked, but is there a way to only print out the file name? Now it prints the whole package like so -> io.netty.util.internal.PlatformDependent0:76 while I just require PlatformDpeendent0:76

node.contents: Try to use %c instead of %F in your pattern. %F - Outputs the file name where the logging request was issued and %c prints logger name. In Netty all logging goes through the wrapper classes in your case it's Slf4JLogger.class

astNode.text: Try to use %c instead of %F in your pattern. %F - Outputs the file name where the logging request was issued and %c prints logger name. In Netty all logging goes through the wrapper classes in your case it's Slf4JLogger.class
